meanings.definition: A plant of the parsley family with yellow flowers and an aromatic scent.
meanings.sent1: The alexanders grew tall in the garden, filling the air with its pleasant smell.
meanings.sent2: I spotted some alexanders by the roadside, their bright yellow blooms catching my eye.
meanings.sent3: The bees buzzed happily around the alexanders, enjoying the sweet nectar it offered.
meanings.sent4: Herbalists often compare the healing properties of alexanders to those of other aromatic plants.
meanings.sent5: The children loved playing hide-and-seek among the alexanders, their laughter echoing in the fragrant air.

meanings.definition: A yellowish color resembling that of the plant alexanders.
meanings.sent1: The artist mixed just the right shades to create a beautiful alexanders hue on the canvas.
meanings.sent2: The sunset painted the sky in stunning alexanders tones, casting a warm glow over the landscape.
meanings.sent3: The room was bathed in a soft alexanders light, creating a cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The fields stretched out in an endless sea of alexanders, a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: Her dress shimmered in an elegant alexanders sheen, catching the light with every movement.
